page.title: 08BLACKMORE VALE FARMING
page.content: This area is covered by part of the hamlet of Stalbridge Weston in which are two small farms.To the west is a big arable and dairy farm,part of a big combine of farms managed by 3 men with extra help when needed.150 acres produce wheat barley and some oats. The remainder well cultivated pasture for grazing and silage.One small farm has 60 beef cattle and grows wheat. The other has a small dairy herd. Mainly wealthy retired folk live in Stalbridge Weston. The former public house and junior/infant school are now private homes.A private room formerly used weekly for a church service is no longer used.6 local children go by bus to nearby schools.2 others go to boarding schools. Milk is transported to Wincanton Milk Depot.Calves to Sturminster Market. Stalbridge is favoured for shopping.
